options.text: They become less sensitive to the pain caused by spicy food.

options.label: B
options.text: They become more sensitive to the pain caused by spicy food.

options.label: C
options.text: They don't experience any changes in their sensitivity to the pain caused by spicy food.

options.label: D
options.text: They experience a decrease in their overall pain tolerance.

title: Is there a difference between art and craft? - Laura Morelli

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between art and craft, according to the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: Art is created for its own sake, while craft is created for practical use.

options.label: B
options.text: Art is created by individuals, while craft is created by groups.

options.label: C
options.text: Art is valued for its beauty and adherence to tradition, while craft is valued for its functionality.

options.label: D
options.text: Art is considered a symbol of social status, while craft is not.

multiple-choice.question: What historical event led to the distinction between art and craft?

options.label: A
options.text: The Renaissance Humanism movement in Florence, Italy.

options.label: B
options.text: The rise of guilds in medieval Europe.

options.label: C
options.text: The publication of Giorgio Vasari's book, "Lives of the Most Excellent Painters, Sculptors and Architects."

options.label: D
options.text: The development of new materials and technologies.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the term "Renaissance Humanism" in the context of art and craft?

options.label: A
options.text: It refers to the movement that led to the creation of the Mona Lisa.

options.label: B
options.text: It refers to the cultural ideal that emerged in Florence, Italy, which valued individual creativity over collective production.

options.label: C
options.text: It refers to the guild system that dominated medieval Europe.

options.label: D
options.text: It refers to the publication of Giorgio Vasari's book.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's argument regarding the distinction between art and craft?

options.label: A
options.text: That art is inherently superior to craft.

options.label: B
options.text: That the distinction between art and craft is based on cultural and historical factors.

options.label: C
options.text: That art and craft are mutually exclusive.

options.label: D
options.text: That art and craft are interchangeable terms.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's suggestion for a more inclusive term to replace "art" and "craft"?

options.label: A
options.text: "Visual arts"

options.label: B
options.text: "Creative expression"

options.label: C
options.text: "Aesthetic production"

options.label: D
options.text: "Fine arts"

title: Islam, the Quran, and the Five Pillars

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why people in the West know so little about Islamic history?

options.label: A
options.text: Because Islamic history is not well-documented.

options.label: B
options.text: Because Islamic history is not considered important.

options.label: C
options.text: Because Islamic history is not taught in schools.

options.label: D
options.text: Because Islamic history is not well-understood in the West.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the hijra, which is the journey of Muhammad and his followers from Mecca to Medina in 622 CE?

options.label: A
options.text: It marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar.

options.label: B
options.text: It marks the end of the Islamic calendar.

options.label: C
options.text: It marks the beginning of the Islamic Empire.

options.label: D
options.text: It marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar and the end of the Islamic Empire.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the first caliph after Muhammad's death in 632 CE?

options.label: A
options.text: Abu Bakr

options.label: B
options.text: Umar

options.label: C
options.text: Uthman

options.label: D
options.text: Ali

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the Quran in Islam?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a collection of stories about the Prophet Muhammad.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a collection of sayings and stories about the Prophet Muhammad.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the written record of the revelations Muhammad received from God.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a collection of laws and regulations for Muslims.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the dynasty that ruled over the Islamic Empire for more than a hundred years after the death of Ali?

options.label: A
options.text: Umayyads

options.label: B
options.text: Abbasids

options.label: C
options.text: Fatimids

options.label: D
options.text: Ottomans

title: Making waves: The power of concentration gradients - Sasha Wright

multiple-choice.question: What is the process called that moves water all over the Earth, driven by a basic concept called the concentration gradient?

options.label: A
options.text: Ocean currents

options.label: B
options.text: Thermohaline circulation

options.label: C
options.text: Global conveyor belt

options.label: D
options.text: Water circulation

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of temperature in the thermohaline circulation process?

options.label: A
options.text: It causes water molecules to move from low to high concentrations

options.label: B
options.text: It causes water molecules to move from high to low concentrations

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the movement of water molecules

options.label: D
options.text: It causes salt ions to move from high to low concentrations

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of the sun's rays on the concentration of salt ions in the ocean?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the concentration of salt ions

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases the concentration of salt ions

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the concentration of salt ions

options.label: D
options.text: It causes salt ions to move from low to high concentrations

multiple-choice.question: What is the driving force behind the movement of salt ions in the thermohaline circulation process?

options.label: A
options.text: A: Temperature

options.label: B
options.text: Salinity

options.label: C
options.text: Concentration gradient

options.label: D
options.text: Pressure

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a concentration gradient in everyday life?

options.label: A
options.text: The movement of water molecules from high to low concentrations in the ocean

options.label: B
options.text: The flow of electricity through a wire

options.label: C
options.text: The movement of oxygen molecules from high to low concentrations in the bloodstream

options.label: D
options.text: The movement of salt ions from low to high concentrations in the ocean
